item.title: Michigan 2009 strawberry season delayed by cold weather
item.description: Here's some reports from around the state of the strawberry crop.  (We're planning a trip to Rowe's in Rawsonville for Father's Day). From the Detroit Free Press via FreshPlaza: At DeGroot's Strawberries in Gregory, 16 acres of lush plants are close to ripening. "It's not too hot and could be a little warmer," says Marsha DeGroot, who with her family has owned the Livingston County farm since 1978. "But the lovely winter with lots of snow made for a nice insulating blanket for the plants.
